intro: Iris fedtschenkoi, commonly known as the Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, sword-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its robust growth and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
